alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 21 at 1:36PM PDT until March 23 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Up to a foot of snow is expected above 5000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...San Diego County Mountains. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 5 AM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snow level will fall to around 5500 feet for late this afternoon and 4000 feet for late tonight. The snow level will then fluctuate around 4500 feet for Wednesday afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For road condition information in California...enter 8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or 9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.
